close_reason: All P1, P2, and P3 feature tickets completed. Native Android client for OpenCode AI agent implemented with full UI feature set.

title: Add contentDescription to icons in ProjectsScreen.kt
close_reason: Fixed contentDescription=null in ProjectsScreen.kt

title: Cannot disconnect from server - auto-reconnects immediately
description: Once a server is added and connected, the user cannot disconnect because the app immediately reconnects. The disconnect action is effectively useless - need a way to intentionally stay disconnected until user explicitly reconnects.
close_reason: Fixed by adding shouldReconnect flag to OpenCodeEventSource. When disconnect() is called intentionally, the flag is set to false preventing scheduleReconnect() from triggering. The flag is reset to true when connect() is explicitly called.

title: Fix buggy behavior with multiple terminals
close_reason: Fixed multiple terminals bug - each PTY session now has its own TerminalEmulator instance stored in a map. Switching between sessions preserves scrollback buffer. Previously all sessions shared one emulator which was cleared on switch.

title: Setup Termux button does not respond to taps
close_reason: Fixed openTermuxSetup to open Termux directly when permission not granted

title: Migrate java.text.SimpleDateFormat in MessageBranching to kotlinx.datetime
description: MessageBranching.kt:433 uses java.text.SimpleDateFormat while the rest of the codebase uses kotlinx.datetime. Migrate for consistency and better API.
close_reason: Migrated java.util.Date/SimpleDateFormat to kotlinx.datetime.Instant/toLocalDateTime. Also fixed deprecated Icons.Default.CallSplit to use AutoMirrored version.

title: Audit all settings to verify they are functional
close_reason: Audited all settings screens. Fixed VisualSettingsScreen - settings were not persisted (only in memory). Added visual settings keys to SettingsDataStore and updated VisualSettingsViewModel to persist settings. Other screens (ProviderConfig, ModelControls, Agents, Skills) work correctly - they fetch data from API. Note: Agent/Skill toggle switches are UI-only (no server API to persist enable/disable state).
